tit.j: 村屋坐弥冨都比売神社

sen.j: 村屋坐弥冨都比売神社（むらやにますみふつひめじんじゃ）は、奈良県磯城郡田原本町にある神社である。
sen.e: Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki-county, Nara Prefecture.
Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki-county, Nara Prefecture.
Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki-county, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 式内社で、旧社格は県社。
sen.e: It is a shikinaisha (shrine listed in the Engishiki laws) and a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.
It is a shikinaisha (shrine listed in the Engishiki laws) and was prefectural shrine under the old shrine ranking system.
It is a shikinaisha (shrine listed in the Engishiki laws) and was prefectural shrine under the old shrine ranking system.

sen.j: 大和の古道の一つ「中つ道」（橘街道）に面して鎮座している。
sen.e: It is located on 'Nakatsu Michi' (Tachibana Kaido), one of the old roads in Yamato.
It is located on 'Nakatsu Michi' (Tachibana Kaido), one of the old roads in Yamato.
It is located on 'Nakatsu Michi' (Tachibana Kaido), one of the old roads in Yamato.

sen.j: 三穂津姫（別名 弥富都比売神）を主祭神とし、大物主を配祀する。
sen.e: The main enshrined deity is Mihotsu-hime (another name is Mifutsuhime no kami), and Omononushi is also enshrined as an associated deity.
The main enshrined deity is Mihotsu-hime (another name is Mifutsuhime no kami), and Omononushi is also enshrined as an associated deity.
The main enshrined deity is Mihotsu-hime (another name is Mifutsuhime no kami), and Omononushi is also enshrined as an associated deity.

sen.j: 三穂津姫命は大国主の后神であり、記紀神話では大物主と大国主は同神としている。
sen.e: Mihotsu-hime no mikoto is Omononushi's wife and according to Kiki-shinwa (the Kojiki, Nihonshoki and mythology), Omononushi and Okuninushi are one god.
Mihotsu-hime no mikoto is Omononushi's wife and according to Kiki-shinwa (the Kojiki, Nihonshoki and mythology), Omononushi and Okuninushi are one god.
Mihotsu-hime no mikoto is Omononushi's wife and according to Kiki-shinwa (the Kojiki, Nihonshoki and mythology), Omononushi and Okuninushi are one god.

sen.j: 大物主命は大神神社の祭神であり、その后神を祀る当社はその別宮とされる。
sen.e: Omononushi no mikoto is the deity of Omiwa-jinja Shrine, and this shrine, which enshrines his wife, is its betsugu, associated shrine.
Omononushi no mikoto is the deity of Omiwa-jinja Shrine, and this shrine, which enshrines his wife, is its betsugu, associated shrine.
Omononushi no mikoto is the deity of Omiwa-jinja Shrine, and this shrine, which enshrines his wife, is its betsugu, associated shrine.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 創立の年代は不詳である。
sen.e: The year of the foundation is unknown.
The year of the shrine's founding is unknown.
The year of the shrine's founding is unknown.

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（673年）の壬申の乱のとき、村屋神が大海人皇子方の大伴吹負に「敵が来るので中つ道を防げ」と神託をした功績により神階が授与されたとの記述が『日本書紀』にある。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) says that Murayanokami was given shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) as credit for telling OTOMO no Fukei on the side of Oama no oji (Prince Oama) 'Guard Nakatsu Michi because the enemies are coming' during the Jinshin War in 673.

"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) says that Murayanokami was granted a shinkai (rank granted to Shinto gods) as credit for telling OTOMO no Fukei on the side of Oama no oji (Prince Oama) 'Guard Nakatsu Michi because the enemies are coming' during the Jinshin War in 673.

"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) says that Murayanokami was granted a shinkai (rank granted to Shinto gods) as credit for telling OTOMO no Fukei on the side of Oama no oji (Prince Oama) 'Guard Nakatsu Michi because the enemies are coming' during the Jinshin War in 673.

sen.j: 神階の授与の記事はこれが初出である。
sen.e: This was the first article of giving shinkai.
This was the first article referring to the granting of shinkai.
This was the first article referring to the granting of shinkai.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では大社に列している。
sen.e: It is listed as a taisha (large shrine) in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).
It is listed as a taisha (large shrine) in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).
It is listed as a taisha (large shrine) in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).

sen.j: 昭和2年（1926年）に県社に昇格した。
sen.e: In 1926, it was promoted to a prefectural shrine.
In 1926, it was promoted to a prefectural shrine.
In 1926, it was promoted to a prefectural shrine.

sen.j: 境内社
sen.e: Shrines in the precincts
Auxiliary Shrines within the Precinct
Auxiliary Shrines within the Precinct

sen.j: 摂社 村屋神社（むらやじんじゃ）
sen.e: Sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely-related to that of a main shrine) Muraya-jinja Shrine
Sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely-related to that of a main shrine): Muraya-jinja Shrine
Sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely-related to that of a main shrine): Muraya-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 式内社。
sen.e: Shikinaisha
sen.cmt: ２回目以降は説明は省きました。
sen.e: Shikinaisha
Shikinaisha

sen.j: 祭神 天児屋命・経津主神・比売神・タケミカヅチ・大伴健持大連・室屋大連
sen.e: Enshrined deities Amenokoyane no mikoto, Futsunushi no kami, Himenokami, Takemikazuchi, OTOMO no Takemochi no Omuraji, Muroya Omuraji
Enshrined deities: Amenokoyane no mikoto, Futsunushi no kami, Himenokami, Takemikazuchi, OTOMO no Takemochi no Omuraji, Muroya Omuraji
Enshrined deities: Amenokoyane no mikoto, Futsunushi no kami, Himenokami, Takemikazuchi, OTOMO no Takemochi no Omuraji, Muroya Omuraji

sen.j: 元は現在地の東の川辺、字宮ノ山に鎮座していたが、天正12年に兵火にかかり、当社境内に遷座した。
sen.e: It was originally located in Umiyanoyama, Kawabe, which is to the east of the present place, however, it was relocated to the precincts of this shrine due to a fire caused by the war in 1584.
sen.cmt: 東の方向にある川辺という地名の宇宮ノ山にあった、と解釈しました。また「宇宮ノ山」の読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: It was originally located in Umiyanoyama, Kawabe, which is to the east of the present site but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine due to a fire caused by conflict in 1584.

It was originally located in Umiyanoyama, Kawabe, which is to the east of the present site but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine due to a fire caused by conflict in 1584.

sen.j: 末社 服部神社（はっとりじんじゃ）
sen.e: Massha (Surbordinate shrine) Hattori-jinja Shrine
Massha (subordinate shrine): Hattori-jinja Shrine
Massha (subordinate shrine): Hattori-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 式内社。
sen.e: Shikinaisha

sen.j: 祭神 天之御中主神、天之御鉾命
sen.e: Enshrined deities Ame no Minakanushi no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology), 天之御鉾命
sen.cmt: 「天之御鉾命」の読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Enshrined deities: Ame no Minakanushi no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology), Ame no Mihokonomikoto
sen.cmt: 天之御鉾命 > Ame no Mihokonomikoto
sen.e: Enshrined deities: Ame no Minakanushi no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology), Ame no Mihokonomikoto

sen.j: 元は大字大安寺カキノモリに鎮座していたが、南北朝時代に兵火にかかり、天正元年（1573年）に当社境内に遷座した。
sen.e: It was originally located in Daianji-kakinomori, however, it was relocated to the precincts of this shrine in 1573 due to fire caused by war in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

It was originally located in Daianji-kakinomori but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine in 1573 due to fire caused by conflict during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

It was originally located in Daianji-kakinomori but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine in 1573 due to fire caused by conflict during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 摂社 久須須美神社（恵比須神社）（くすすみじんじゃ）
sen.e: Sessha Kususumi-jinja Shrine
Sessha: Kususumi-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 祭神 天之久之比命・事代主
sen.e: Enshrined deities 天之久之比命 and Kotoshironushi.
sen.cmt: 「天之久之比命」の読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Enshrined deities: Ame no Kushihi and Kotoshironushi.
sen.cmt: 天之久之比命 > Ame no Kushihi
sen.e: Enshrined deities: Ame no Kushihi and Kotoshironushi.

sen.j: 元は現在地の東の川辺、恵比須山に鎮座していたが、慶応2年に当社境内に遷座した。
sen.e: It was originally located in Ebisuyama, Kawabe, which is to the east of the present place, however, it was relocated to the precincts of this shrine in 1866.
sen.cmt: 東の方向にある川辺という地名の恵比須山にあった、と解釈しました。
sen.e: It was originally located in Ebisuyama, Kawabe to the east of the present site but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrin in 1866.
It was originally located in Ebisuyama, Kawabe to the east of the present site but was relocated to the precinct of Murayanimasumifutsuhime-jinja Shrine in 1866.
sen.cmt: Shrin を Shrine に修正しました。

sen.j: 末社 市杵嶋姫神社（いちきしまひめじんじゃ）・物部神社（もののべじんじゃ）
sen.e: Massha Ichikishimahime-jinja Shrine, Mononobe-jinja Shrine
Massha: Ichikishimahime-jinja Shrine, Mononobe-jinja Shrine
Massha: Ichikishimahime-jinja Shrine, Mononobe-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 祭神 炊屋姫命・宇麻志摩遲命、配祀 物部守屋連。
sen.e: The enshrined deities Kashikiyahime no Mikoto and Umashimaji no Mikoto The associated deity MONONOBE no Moriya no Muraji.
Enshrined deities: Kashikiyahime no Mikoto, Umashimaji no Mikoto, and the associated deity MONONOBE no Moriya no Muraji.
Enshrined deities: Kashikiyahime no Mikoto, Umashimaji no Mikoto, and the associated deity MONONOBE no Moriya no Muraji.

sen.j: 由緒は不詳で、社家・守屋家の祖神を祀ったものという。
sen.e: The history is unknown but it is said to enshrine soshin (an ancestor honored as a god) of shake (family of priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis), the Moriya family.
Its history is unknown but it is said to enshrine the soshin (an ancestor honored as a god) of the Moriya shake (family of priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) family.
